body_html:
This is an explicit choice, see #1781
I believe the reason why it was removed was that it made implicit assumptions that do not hold anymore because of broadcasting/
For example, before we could add a 2x2 and a 4 dimensional tensor, which is not supported anymore (or raises a warning).
Also, it's behavior was different from numpy's when multiple dimensions are taken into account, which could confuse users.

cc @gchanan if I missed something here.

body:
This is an explicit choice, see https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/1781
I believe the reason why it was removed was that it made implicit assumptions that do not hold anymore because of broadcasting/
For example, before we could add a `2x2` and a `4` dimensional tensor, which is not supported anymore (or raises a warning).
Also, it's behavior was different from numpy's when multiple dimensions are taken into account, which could confuse users.

cc @gchanan if I missed something here.
